segment.source: How to Upgrade the Servers and System Components
segment.target: How to Upgrade the Servers and System Components

segment.source: How to Upgrade the Servers and System Components
segment.target: How to Upgrade the Servers and System Components

segment.source: How to Upgrade the Servers and System Components
segment.target: How to Upgrade the Servers and System Components

segment.source: Use the following procedure to upgrade software components installed on all Application Virtualization System computers.
segment.target: Use the following procedure to upgrade software components installed on all Application Virtualization System computers.

segment.source: Application Virtualization System services will be restarted automatically on each computer after it has been upgraded.
segment.target: Application Virtualization System services will be restarted automatically on each computer after it has been upgraded.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: The upgrade process stops all Application Virtualization System services, thereby taking the system out of service.
segment.target: The upgrade process stops all Application Virtualization System services, thereby taking the system out of service.

segment.source: User sessions should be shut down before you begin the upgrade process, and you should stop all Application Virtualization Server services in your environment.
segment.target: User sessions should be shut down before you begin the upgrade process, and you should stop all Application Virtualization Server services in your environment.

segment.source: If you have more than one server that is sharing access to the Application Virtualization database, all those servers must be taken offline while the database is being upgraded.
segment.target: If you have more than one server that is sharing access to the Application Virtualization database, all those servers must be taken offline while the database is being upgraded.

segment.source: You should follow your normal business practices for the database upgrade, but it is highly advisable that you test the database upgrade by using a backup copy of the database first on a test server.
segment.target: You should follow your normal business practices for the database upgrade, but it is highly advisable that you test the database upgrade by using a backup copy of the database first on a test server.

segment.source: Then, you should select one of the servers for the first upgrade, which will upgrade the database schema.
segment.target: Then, you should select one of the servers for the first upgrade, which will upgrade the database schema.

segment.source: After the production database has been successfully upgraded, you can upgrade the other servers.
segment.target: After the production database has been successfully upgraded, you can upgrade the other servers.

segment.source: You can upgrade to Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) 4.5 only from Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) 4.1 or 4.1 SP1.
segment.target: You can upgrade to Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) 4.5 only from Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) 4.1 or 4.1 SP1.

segment.source: App-V 4.0 and earlier must be uninstalled or upgraded to 4.1 or 4.1 SP1 before upgrading to App-V 4.5.
segment.target: App-V 4.0 and earlier must be uninstalled or upgraded to 4.1 or 4.1 SP1 before upgrading to App-V 4.5.

segment.source: To upgrade software components on Application Virtualization System computers
segment.target: To upgrade software components on Application Virtualization System computers

segment.source: Navigate to the location of the Setup program on the network, either run this program from the network or copy its directory to the target computer, and then double-click the Setup.exe file.
segment.target: Navigate to the location of the Setup program on the network, either run this program from the network or copy its directory to the target computer, and then double-click the Setup.exe file.

segment.source: On the Welcome page of the Installation Wizard, click Next.
segment.target: On the Welcome page of the Installation Wizard, click Next.

segment.source: On the License Agreement page, read the license agreement, check I accept the terms in the license agreement, and click Next.
segment.target: On the License Agreement page, read the license agreement, check I accept the terms in the license agreement, and click Next.

segment.source: When the Installed Software page opens and displays a list of the installed Application Virtualization System components and the version of each component, click Next.
segment.target: When the Installed Software page opens and displays a list of the installed Application Virtualization System components and the version of each component, click Next.

segment.source: On the Session Loss Warning page, read the displayed message and click Next.
segment.target: On the Session Loss Warning page, read the displayed message and click Next.

segment.source: On the Connect to Configuration Database page, review the content on the page and click Next.
segment.target: On the Connect to Configuration Database page, review the content on the page and click Next.

segment.source: If the Database Upgrade Required page is displayed, a database upgrade is required.
segment.target: If the Database Upgrade Required page is displayed, a database upgrade is required.

segment.source: Enter the database administrative credentials, and then click Next.
segment.target: Enter the database administrative credentials, and then click Next.

segment.source: If this page is not displayed, skip to Step 9.
segment.target: If this page is not displayed, skip to Step 9.

segment.source: On the Backup Configuration Database page, check the appropriate boxes to perform the backup and export it to an existing location, and then click Next.
segment.target: On the Backup Configuration Database page, check the appropriate boxes to perform the backup and export it to an existing location, and then click Next.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: If you want to be able to roll back to the previous version in the event of an upgrade failure, make sure you check the Perform a backup of the configuration database box, or you will lose the configuration data.
segment.target: If you want to be able to roll back to the previous version in the event of an upgrade failure, make sure you check the Perform a backup of the configuration database box, or you will lose the configuration data.

segment.source: When you want to restore a database with VSS, you must first stop the App-V Server Service on the Management Server.
segment.target: When you want to restore a database with VSS, you must first stop the App-V Server Service on the Management Server.

segment.source: This should be done on every Management server if there is more than one server connected to the same database.
segment.target: This should be done on every Management server if there is more than one server connected to the same database.

segment.source: On the first Package Validation page, read the content and then click Next.
segment.target: On the first Package Validation page, read the content and then click Next.

segment.source: On the second Package Validation page, you have the option of displaying the details of the package validation in a Notepad window.
segment.target: On the second Package Validation page, you have the option of displaying the details of the package validation in a Notepad window.

segment.source: To see the details, click Details; otherwise, click Next.
segment.target: To see the details, click Details; otherwise, click Next.

segment.source: On the Ready to Upgrade the Program page, click Next.
segment.target: On the Ready to Upgrade the Program page, click Next.

segment.source: On the Installation Wizard Completed page, click Finish.
segment.target: On the Installation Wizard Completed page, click Finish.

segment.source: Repeat steps 1–12 on all other computers where you installed the Application Virtualization Management Console or the Application Virtualization Server software component.
segment.target: Repeat steps 1–12 on all other computers where you installed the Application Virtualization Management Console or the Application Virtualization Server software component.

segment.source: After upgrading the data store, you can resume normal operation.
segment.target: After upgrading the data store, you can resume normal operation.

segment.source: (The data store is upgraded when you upgrade any server or the App-V Management Web Service.)
segment.target: (The data store is upgraded when you upgrade any server or the App-V Management Web Service.)

segment.target: Related topics

segment.target: Application Virtualization Deployment and Upgrade Considerations
